body:
I have tested the above-mentioned notebook on Windows 10, Python 3.8.11. It worked for me and didn't throw any errors. 
@lmmentel @fkiraly could it be a problem specific to a particular OS?

Thanks for testing @Aparna-Sakshi! The problem with this one is that it was flaky i.e. intermittent. On a few instances I managed to run start the notebook and run though all the cells and sometimes the kernel would die. I had more troubles executing the command I pasted which is actually used in CI/CD. Could you also test that?
@lmmentel I have tried both the command line as well as ran all the cells in the notebook. But I still wasn't able to reproduce the bug. I'll try running it a couple of times more.
Have you tried repeatedly? @lmmentel says it´s sporadic or intermittent.

I can reproduce in latest `main` no prob https://asciinema.org/a/nN8MAgJbEvV5gLrnsbs5NUsdE

with:
- os: linux
- python 3.8.10

I run a check just now and notebooks work on py38 and py39 so this can be closed until the issue reappears. Thanks for the help @Aparna-Sakshi
